thread.section_title: Eastern Iowa Sports News and Information from Gazette Online
thread.title: Mark Mangino out as Iowa State offensive coordinator
thread.title_full: Mark Mangino out as Iowa State offensive coordinator

title: Mark Mangino out as Iowa State offensive coordinator
text:
Mark Mangino out as Iowa State offensive coordinator Mark Mangino out as Iowa State offensive coordinator Rhoads, Mangino could not work through differences Photos Video Mark Mangino talks to head coach Paul Rhoads as they play Northern Iowa in the second quarter Saturday, Sept. 5, 2015, at Jack Trice Stadium in Ames. Rhoads announced Monday Mangino is out as ISU offensive coordinator. Here is head coach Paul Rhoads' opening statement at today's @CycloneFB media conference, announcing a change at OC https://t.co/2NGDLxaMHk October 26, 2015 | 12:12 pm 
Iowa State head coach Paul Rhoads announced a change at offensive coordinator Monday. 
Mark Mangino, who arrived in Ames last fall, is no longer with the Cyclones. Quarterbacks coach Todd Sturdy, in his fourth year with the Cyclones after serving as Washington State offensive coordinator from 2008-11, will take over. 
Rhoads said he and Mangino were not seeing eye to eye. 
“Mark and I could not get on the same page on a few important items,” Rhoads said. “We tried to talk that through this morning in an effort to get us moving in a different direction. In the end, Mark was not interested in that. I wish that wasn't the case. But I respect and understand his conviction. 
“I'd like to thank Mark for all that he's done for our football program and wish him well.” 
Mangino was the head coach at Kansas from 2002-09 and assisted at Youngstown State in 2013 before coming to Iowa State. 
The move comes the same day sophomore Joel Lanning replaced senior Sam Richardson as the starting quarterback on the ISU depth chart, though Rhoads claimed the decisions were unrelated. 
Mangino's son, Tommy, will stay on as wide receivers coach. 
Rhoads said he had not broke the news to his team, wanting to tell them in person at a 1:30 p.m. meeting. 
That resulted in several players discovering the news as it broke on Twitter at the same time as fans. Wut — Oni Omoile (@Oni_Omoile) October 26, 2015 Uh what — Cole Anderson (@Cole_Anderson86) October 26, 2015 Wow. — Scotty Schaffner (@KingSchaffner) October 26, 2015 
The Cyclones (2-5, 1-3 Big 12) have lost three games in a row, two to highly ranked teams, and host Texas (3-4, 2-2) on Saturday. Your Next College Football Articles
